It’s in close proximity (or quick subway ride away) from the tourist traps, but the chic hotel with 168 bright, breezy rooms is a destination worthy of itself. Hit up the restaurant downstairs for Daniel Humm’s more casual but no less luxurious cooking—roast chicken stuffed with foie gras and truffles—or slink into the moody, tavern-like bar for equally showstopping drinks, like the massive large-format Whiskey Smash.THE VIBE IS: swanky but crowded downstairs at the venues, often frequented by finance folks who work close by or tourists staying at the hotel. But the rooms, outfitted with clawfoot tubs and custom linens and bathrobes from luxe Italian designers Sferra and Frette, are the perfect escape from the Midtown tourist hustle.PRACTICAL STUFF: Rates start at $285.—Elyse InamineBenoit LineroBenoit LineroWE ALSO LOVEEleven Madison ParkFour-star dining redefined from hit makers Daniel Humm and Will GuidaraJohn DerianBeautiful presents (for yourself and others) awaitKeens SteakhouseNYC’s classic midtown steakhouse—still perfect after all these yearsExplore City GuidesAtlantaAustinBostonCharlestonChicagoCopenhagenLas VegasLondonLos AngelesMexico CityMiamiMontrealNew OrleansNew YorkParisPhiladelphiaPortlandSan FranciscoSeattleTokyoTorontoVancouverWashington, D.C.GET THE MAGAZINEBA LogoBon appetitSUBSCRIBESign up for Updates on the Bon AppétitCity GuidesSign UpWill be used in accordance with our user agreement and privacy policyBA LogoBon appetitSubscription FAQsMastheadNewsletter SignupAccessibility HelpRSS FeedsSite MapCondé Nast StoreCareersBon Appétit Media KitDo Not Sell My Personal InformationCondé NastFood Innovation Group: Bon Appétit and Epicurious© 2022 Condé Nast.
